TopicTitle: Why isn't the new .21.1 patch on steam?

Articles.Content: Is there a reason my steam version of ksp hasn't got the patch? Or have the devs not got round to uploading the update?
i got the update just fine, no problem what so ever
Try right-clicking on the game, go to the Local Files tab, and then Verify Game Cache. And check the Updates to see if you disabled automatic updates.
Also, if the above doesn't work, just close and restart Steam. I couldn't get .21 until I did that.

It updated fine for me, If all else fails, you can always uninstall it through steam and do the reinstall. Don't forget you will have to update some mods, like Mechjeb, if you use them. If you use them, some of the ship you built previously will not work. One ship I had froze the game completely when I tried to load. I eventually had to delete it and recreate it.

Steam will automatically update the game on its own. Your client should read version 0.21.1.276 , if it does not, right click the game in the list, go to properties, click on the update tab, and make sure it says 'Always keep this game up to date', if it does not, click the drop box , and select that option. If it does say this, set it to the opposite, launch the game, exit the game, then go back to the properties and set it to keep the game up to date. This should fix it, if not, restart steam.

Is there a reason my steam version of ksp hasn't got the patch? Or have the devs not got round to uploading the update?

I thought the same thing but when I booted the game up it was already updated. Try starting it and check the version in te lower right.

Ok thanks guys it turns out i was being dumb, i had set myself to offline mode and forgot to reset myself back to online *facepalm*. But thanks anyway.

hmm now how do I edit the thread to say answered? XD

Edited July 26, 2013 by Boamere

Edit the first post, choose "Advanced" then change the status in the drop-down menu.

Glad you figured out the problem.

Ok thanks guys it turns out i was being dumb, i had set myself to offline mode and forgot to reset myself back to online *facepalm*. But thanks anyway.

hmm now how do I edit the thread to say answered? XD

Troubleshooting 101 -- Is it plugged in? Is it turned on? I've lost count of how many times forgetting one or both of those questions has lead to tech support headaches (since I'm the tech).

I had the worst time of trying to figure this out. My game was not updating on steam as well, i did everything i could think of, verify the local files, delete local content, restart steam ect ect ect and nothing worked, However what ended up being my problem was if you right click on kerbal and go to properties there will be a tab that say BETAS, it MUST be set to "NONE- opt out of all betas" once i did that and applied it kerbal updated on the spot. So if all else fails check that setting.
I just closed and restarted the Steam Client and it downloaded after that
